original_solution_mapping.L1: Total pieces of gum are 54 pieces + 45 pieces + 0 pieces = <<54+45=99>>99 pieces
original_solution_mapping.L2: When the pieces are shared equally amongst 3 people, each one gets 99 pieces / 3 people = <<99/3=33>>33 pieces/person

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1387.
    Returns: the number of pieces of gum each person will get.
    """
    # L1
    johns_gum = 54 # John has 54 pieces of gum
    coles_gum = 45 # Cole has 45 pieces of gum
    aubreys_gum = 0 # Aubrey has no pieces of gum
    total_gum_pieces = johns_gum + coles_gum + aubreys_gum

    # L2
    number_of_people = 3 # between the 3 of them
    gum_per_person = total_gum_pieces / number_of_people

    # FA
    answer = gum_per_person
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Total pieces of gum are {johns_gum} pieces + {coles_gum} pieces + {aubreys_gum} pieces = <<{johns_gum}+{coles_gum}={total_gum_pieces}>>{total_gum_pieces} pieces

When the pieces are shared equally amongst {number_of_people} people, each one gets {total_gum_pieces} pieces / {number_of_people} people = <<{total_gum_pieces}/{number_of_people}={gum_per_person}>>{gum_per_person} pieces/person

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Total pieces of gum are 54 pieces + 45 pieces + 0 pieces = <<54+45=99>>99 pieces
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: When the pieces are shared equally amongst 3 people, each one gets 99 pieces / 3 people = <<99/3=96>>96 pieces/person

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '-' instead.
